alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Johnston; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 07 at 9:00AM CDT until June 07 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT FOR EASTERN JOHNSTON...SOUTHERN COAL...SOUTHEASTERN PONTOTOC AND SOUTHWESTERN ATOKA COUNTIES... At 859 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tupelo to near Clarita to 4 miles northwest of Fillmore, moving southeast at 55 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR Tupelo, Clarita, and Olney. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Atoka, Tishomingo, Coalgate, Stonewall, Wapanucka, Lehigh, Tupelo, Milburn, Bromide, Centrahoma, Pontotoc, Fittstown, Clarita, Olney, Fillmore, Reagan, Connerville, Coleman, Nida and Phillips. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
